Neighbors, as our community continues to mourn alongside our friends in El Paso, I will hold special office hours tomorrow to make myself available to anyone who would like to share their thoughts on this weekend‚Äôs tragedy.

This weekend‚Äôs tragedies are too commonplace & we must honor the memory of the victims of both tragedies w/ action, not only thoughts & prayers. Time for the Senate to follow the House‚Äôs leadership & pass universal background checks. The safety of our communities depend on it.

Hate & racism should have no place in our country. The El Paso shooter used both to target innocent lives. We must stand together to show the hate he spewed does not reflect the diverse America we know & love.
Thank you to all the law enforcement officers & first responders who have shown courage and compassion throughout these tragedies. New Mexico stands with El Paso and Dayton today.

As El Paso unites and reels from yesterday‚Äôs tragedy, we wake up to the horror that the city of Dayton is living through a similar nightmare. To our friends in Dayton, we stand with you. As we learn more about last night‚Äôs shooting, we hold the Dayton community in our hearts.
We watch the developing situation in El Paso with sorrowful hearts. Neighbors, we are with you. If you have any information that may assist the investigation, please contact @EPPOLICE.
